instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
Board was messed with somewhere else and I have no history.

PPBUS is 1V

U7100, Q7130 and Q7155 I replaced but same problem

U7100 Resistance between 17/18 is 3 Ohm , resistance on 27/28 is 20 Ohm, this was bad before but I fixed it by replacing R7121/22 same problem

Removing F7140 gives me 1V at R7150 

PP3v42_G3H is fine at 3.4V

threads.title: 820-00165 PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
"27 - 1.2"
Diode mode to ground?

Try changing Q7180.

threads.title: 820-00165 PPBUS 1V
threads.message:
27 Diode to ground 600 I did check that before the creating the post and it was fine.

Replacing Q7180 did the trick, thanks!
